fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23656].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

The suggestions for labels should be scoped by labels used in a given project.  Or perhaps limited to a project or group specific list.

When multiple teams are using JIRA, they have different conventions for labels for their issues.  By using a single namespace for the suggestions, the teams are presented with potentially ambiguous or misleading suggestions.
fields.summary: Labels suggestion should be scoped by project

fields.description:
This is fully described in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-6146.

To reproduce - open the same issue in 2 diff browsers, and then update them in sequence.  data from the first update will be silently overwritten.  A major concern is that its not possible to easily tell how many issues are and have been affected.
fields.summary: JIRA is prone to silent data loss on concurrent issue updates
Closing an issue where a non-existing user is referenced, should not fail with stacktrace

fields.description:
Security auditing tests performed on a *Jira Bug Issue and Project Tracking Software* locally running instance shown that at least two vulnerabilities regarding *User Enumeration* were found within the software.

Case 1: Logged In

Whenever a logged user accesses the Url [/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=USERNAME] with parameter *name* filled with a non existent user of the system, the message: "The specified user could not be found." is shown. This vulnerability grants the possibility for a low level privileged user to enumerate other users of the system --- including higher level privileged users. The image below describes this behavior:

!01_userEnumLoggedIn.png!

Case 2: Unlogged

From the main login page it is possible to enumerate system users by inserting wrong passwords three times. This procedure triggers a CAPTCHA verification for that user. However, the CAPTCHA verification doesn't appear for non existant users. The first image below describes this behavior, the second one describes the lack of it.

!02_userEnumLoggedOut.png!

!03_userEnumLoggedOut02.png!

Disclaimer: A thorough scan may be done to find out if the CAPTCHA function is a mandatory feature or if it can be disabled. If it can, Case 2 shouldn't be a enumeration.
fields.summary: User Enumeration

fields.description:
When importing issues with attachments from FogBugz, the importer appears to try to use a wrong directory for temporarily storing attachments during the import.

This is a new Jira 4.2.4 standalone installation installed in /opt/jira, temp dir is the default /opt/jira/temp.  During the import I got some errors which indicated that the importer tried to save attachments with file names like /opt/jira/temp:something:otherthing (note missing slash after "temp") which failed because the jira user intentionally does not have write access to /opt/jira, but it does have it to /opt/jira/temp.

I was able to work around it by changing CATALINA_TMPDIR="$CATALINA_BASE"/temp to CATALINA_TMPDIR="$CATALINA_BASE"/temp/ (with the trailing slash) in bin/catalina.sh.
fields.summary: FogBugz importer uses wrong dir for attachments during import

Limit "Assign To" lists to real project users

fields.description:
We want to assign a newly created issue to user A when the reporter is in group G (or role R), or assign it to user B when the reporter is in group H (or role S), else use the default assignment rules.

To meet this need, we are going to try writing our own custom post-function.  It would be nice if it were included in the product.
fields.summary: Include a workflow post-function that allows one to assign an issue to a user based on group or role that the reporter is a member of.

For example, I'm seeing "Assign to Me", but inside it I see "Sem pendências"... 

Investigating more, there are LOTS of places with this kind of problem... :-(

fields.description:
The "submitButtonText" does not use the required syntax for internationalization.
As a result it appears as "Create" instead of the value of the i18n property "common.forms.create".

Trivial change, patch included.
fields.summary: Create button in view createissue-details.jsp is not internationalized

fields.description:
When I create an issue, and the default Assignee of the project is Unassigned, it is automatically assigned to the Project Lead
When I create an issue, and select a component, is is automatically assigned to the Component lead, even though the assignment rules for that component specifically designate the default assignee as Unassigned.

in other words, Jira does not respect that i have set the default assignees to Unassigned.

Am I missing some obscure setting?  Because this only started happening when we upgraded to Jira 4.x .  Was not a problem on jira 3.1.3.

Funny thing is - on our dev Jira instance, the same settings as on live,  this works like intended.  I.e. if i set the default project assignee as unassigned, and the default component assignee as either Unassigned, or the project default (Unassigned), then it works like intended.  if the creator of the issue selects an assignee, then it is assigned to him and not the Project or Component Leads by default.

I know this is most likely a repost, but the issues I looked at were created many years ago.  Have any more users been affected by this?
fields.summary: Jira does not respect Unassigned as the default assignee.

fields.description:
Per the attached diff, the following line was removed from attachment-edit.vm between versions 4.2.1 and 4.2.3 (at least for the EAR/WAR version):

#customControlFooter ($action "attachment_field" $fieldLayoutItem.getFieldDescription() $displayParameters $auiparams)

This seems to prevent a closing DIV tag from appearing in any transition screen with the Attachments field enabled which breaks the formatting of the page. This accompanied by the JFS plugin will prevent any fields below the Attachments field from being displayed whatsoever. If I either re-add the aforementioned customControlFooter line or remove the unterminated customControlHeader line, formatting is restored.
fields.summary: Recent update to attachment-edit.vm template breaks HTML formatting due to missing DIV closing tag

fields.description:
I run Jira and Confluence standalone.  Suse Linux.

I am being forced to support JASIG CAS as a front end to Jira and Confluence.
Soulwing CAS is no longer supported.  Crowd does not mention CAS.  While my site
has been using LDAP large scale for over a decade, they are very stingy about direct access
and want to leverage SSO with JASIG CAS which we support.  The Soulwing CAS interface is starting
to drop some details like last login time.  Since CAS has lots of University support, I think it would
be smart for Atlassian to add CAS to its wiki roadmap for Jira, Confluence, and Crowd.
fields.summary: Jira, Confluence, Crowd, and CAS

AT&amp;T is suggested. 

!amp.png!
fields.summary: Ampersand &amp encoding shows up in JQL Auto Complete if option begins with 'a' and contains an ampersand

fields.description: jira.max.JQLQuery.history.items should be settable per user, and an application UI (possibly in the user profile) should be made available for the user to set this value, and to clear out the JQL (Issue Navigator) history.
fields.summary: JQL history control should be user scope

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23631].
  {panel}

At present, if you wish to display links in filter results, you've got one option for your column - Issue Links.
This is useful to a point. You can see all of the related issues and whether they are resolved or not.
However, you cannot see the relationship between the linked issues.

It would be really useful if you could select a relationship from the issue navigator column selection.
This would allow you to break out single relationships into individual columns.
fields.summary: Allow selection of individual relationships as columns in issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

In case CROWD isn't running, JIRA displays a bad error message when user trying to login.

Something like it's displayed:

* "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://jira.test.com/rest/gadget/1.0/login."

It must be change to a more user friendly message.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Start JIRA.
# Don't start CROWD.
# Try to login into JIRA.

\\This improvement refers to the support case: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-72610
fields.summary: Bad error message when JIRA cannot reach CROWD

fields.description:
Our managerial tester has requested the ability to view all changes made for a particular project e.g. with each reassignment, closure, opening of a JIRA for a specific project created in the JIRA system.  Currently this would be notified via email only to the persons raising/assigned/closing the 1 relevant JIRA.

Please advise how this is possible.
fields.summary: Request for emails to be received for all changes made to jiras for a particular project

fields.description:
We would like a feature request for future versions of JIRA to include the following option: 

Within a workflow, To add a "Condition" where the value of a field  provides an "AND-IF" whereby the set of mandatory fields are dependant on another field value.
e.g.
Where "Review Type" is a custom field:
If value of "Review Type" = "Client Review", the user cannot progress through the JIRA workflow unless fields a, b, c, and d have a particular value.
If value of "Review Type" = "Final Review", the user cannot progress through the JIRA workflow unless fields a, b, e, and f have a particular value.
If value of "Review Type" = "Portal Review", the user cannot progress through the JIRA workflow unless fields a, d, g, h, i, and j have a particular value.


regards
Marianne
fields.summary: AND-IF option in workflows

I think horizontal scrollbar should be add on the cascade select list on the issue search panel, so that long select option can be see by scroll the horizontal scrollbar.

fields.description: We changed our JIRA policy that only the team leaders are eligible to close issues. The former policy was that everyone was able to resolve & close an issue. However JIRA seems to ignore tne new permission scheme I applied, thus still allowing everyone to close an issue without "Close Issue" permission.
fields.summary: CLONE - Close issue permission bug

fields.description:
Using a very large jira installations with hundreds of projects and users, it does provide a very professional look to provide emoticons icons (smileys) whenever these are found in a text string (on purpose or non-purpose). For example, posting a SQL query back as a support solution, can return "funny" looking statements, especially if subselects are used. This is just an example of when its both anoying and unprofessional looking (it becomes facebook-y).

If there was a button somewhere to enable/disable the use of smileys in the jira installation, that could be a huge benefit for us (and for many others i suppose).

We use only jira, no other atlassian product.
fields.summary: Button to disable emoticons in JIRA

fields.description:
When you are searching for issues on the _Issues_ tab of JIRA and you add columns for time tracking (IE: Time Spent or Remaining Estimate) and you export it to Excel, the time is displayed only in seconds.

*Steps to reproduce:*

Go to _Issues_ and perform a search where issues will be returned. Then add columns related to Time Tracking (Time Spent, Original Estimate). You will see all columns correctly (as it can be seen in attached screenshot fielter-results.png)

But when you export it to Excel (_Views > Excel_) the data related to time gets converted to seconds. (See excel-export.png)

It appears that when you export it to XML the problem doesn't occur (See xml_screenshot.png)
fields.summary: Time Tracking converted to seconds on export tickets to Excel

fields.description:
It seems that version information is tied only to the Project.  Various components within a project can have a vast number of components, each of which could be versioned separately.  Is there any way to have the version list apply to a given component selection context.

I understand the tool was written with a specific idea for the definition of a Project, and subsequently a definition for a Component.  I also understand that the tool was written with Software Development in mind.  The latter is a narrow view of the power of the tool you have created.  But using the tool for broader notions of Projects, presumeably with a potential difference in the definition of Project and Component, is hindered by the way certain things are managed.

As an example.  We have a project, call it SAS.  The SAS system comprises five primary subsystems, each with many components within them.  These subsystems or components are either a hardware or software component.  Each is also progressing from a version perspective independently.  It would be burdensome from the Project level, to define a project for each component so it can have its own version stream.  Not to mention if I have 100 such Projects going on, each with many subsystems and components, the project list would get crazy.  An individual working on one project would have to sift through a ton of projects to find the thing they wanted to report an issue against.  Much less of a burden if they can just refer to the component within the project they are familiar with.
fields.summary: Managing versions on a per-component basis within a project

fields.description:

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
1. create a new issue
2. select a version from a version drop-down
3. select another version from the same drop-down

Observed:
Both versions are applied.

Expected:
The second version that was selected should replace the version previously selected. This is the behavior in previous versions of JIRA. It should still be possible to select multiple versions but that should not be the default action.
fields.summary: Version fields should not be additive

fields.description:
In Tomcat 5.5 onwards, there is a setting called "keepgenerated" that retains the generated .java files generated from the .jsp files, for debugging purposes. By default, this is set to true.

We should be overriding this our server.xml or web.xml to false, as source files living on production servers can be viewed as a security risk by some organisations.
fields.summary: Default Tomcat settings keep generated .java files in the Tomcat work directory

fields.description: We have many elements, such as Atlassian UI drop-down menus, which respond only to onClick events. This is shitty for anyone who doesn't use a mouse or click interaction to browse, such as the visually impaired who use screen readers.
fields.summary: every element that responds exclusively to an onClick event should also respond to an onFocus event

fields.description:
Certain drop-down menus in JIRA do not use select tags, aka drop-down menus, but instead have hidden lists that are made visible only through an onClick event. This means that users who do not rely on mouse clicking for browser interaction, ie the visually impaired using screen readers, cannot view the drop down menu.

Examples of this type of "drop-down" are the Reports and Filters menus, found on the project summary page, such as http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF.

*Suggested Resolution*
Add an additional listener for the onFocus event, so that the hidden list is made visible when a user focuses upon the menu title / link.
fields.summary: custom drop-down menus don't activate on focus, are invisible to screen readers

We could consider adding this option as a configuration option in Look and Feel.

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/185729578/lookandfeel-config.png!

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customising+the+Look+and+Feel
fields.summary: Provide ability to change colour from 'Look and feel '

fields.description:
Upgrade task 552 can fail on it first run and then pass on it second run without converting lots of the data.

Scenario:
# Upgrade fails during - updateSearchRequests();
# On second run no customFieldGVs are returned as they were updated in bulk prior to the error above.

This will leave the system in the following state:
# Some search requests will not have been upgraded
# updateGadgetConfigurations wont have run
# customFieldManager.removeCustomFieldPossiblyLeavingOrphanedData wont have been run
# ofBizDelegator.removeByOr(CF_VALUE_ENTITY, "customfield", customFieldIds); wont have been run

All possible issues (that I can think of):
# Field Screens & Field configs with Label custom fields may have issues
# Filter defined columns, user defined columns & system defined columns with Label CFs may have issues
# Any thing that relies on a search that includes a Labels CF may have issues
# Gadgets that used Label CFs may have issues

They should restore, fix the issue and re-upgrade.
If this is not possible, they should contact support.
fields.summary: Upgrade Task for labels can initially fail but then pass on second run with out converting a lot of the data

fields.description:
1.UI is difficult to see. The UI of 4.0 was compact and easy to use.
2.Requires too much scrolling in dropdowns. Dropdowns are missing the scroll bar.Dropdown lists are long and not fully visable. This is because the screen is so big and wide now (especially on laptop). 
3.Actions from left menu have been moved to top of issue as buttons. Our users prefer the left menu.
4.Don't like the visualization of how it displays cascades and linkages. Much more difficult to see. 
Screen shots no longer allow you to enlarge them. Now - they are unreadable. Old Jira version allowed you to enlarge them.
5. On the dashboard, we have to click multiple links in a project, to see the default filters. Before Version 4.0, we could directly go to default filters for the projects.

Suggested Enhancements:
1. New Avatars.
2. Ability to configure default projects. So when we create a search filter, it would be nice to have the ability to select a default project, or at least remember the last used project.
3. Set default filters as a clickable link on Dashboard. (We know we can set favorites, but we really click the clickable link on dashboard.)
4. Better search capability when creating filters
fields.summary: GUI Improvements to Jira 4.2 as suggested by our  Users.
Add "bee" emoticon

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23590].
  {panel}

There is currently no way to prepopulate some of the fields in the "Create Issue" page, so the user gets the standard form to fill in his issue details but some of the fields are pre-populated. Ideally that would be possible by passing the fields as UTF-8 encoded URL params to the create issue URL like that:

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssue.jspa?pid=10240&issuetype=2&Create=Create&summary=A+wonderful+title&description=something+more

This is currently not working. In contrast, it's easily possible to create whole issues, but for this case the user cannot change or add information. For our specific case, the use-case is:

We are using JIRA not only for support but also as submission tool for data publications, supplementary to conventional academic articles (see www.pangaea.de). The user can create an issue and fill in the authors, title, abstract, license of the academic article and submit the supplementary data to us using JIRA. The JIRA issue is used to track the changes and workflows of the data submission. Often this information can be partly prepopulated on issue creation from e.g. an article citation, library catalogues,... This is especially relevant for invoking CreateIssue.jspa from a library catalogue and just wants to add data to the article at our place. In this case, lots of information on the Create Issue page can be pre-populated, but the user should be able to modify and complete the information.

We have seen the confluence page about creating an issue with all fields filled out, but in that case we want to probvide the user the standard create issue form (where he can edit/enter the details) before creating the issue. Just a few fields should be prepopulated.

This should be easily possible by modifying the JSP page to simply pre-populate the value="" of the <input> fields based on the URL parameters.
fields.summary: Support pre-populating issue fields on CreateIssue.jspa

fields.description:

h2. Workarounds

If upgrading from *pre 4.0 to 4.2 or higher*:
You will need to find all the search requests that have something like the following in the reqcontent column (or request element in the xml backup)
{noformat}
<request><![CDATA[<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<searchrequest name='filter-name'/>]]></request>
    </SearchRequest>
{noformat}
You can either delete this filter (through JIRA) or modify the contents to contain an order clause.  Create a new filter and just compy the contents to these Search requests)

*Or*
You could also upgrade to 4.0 or 4.1 then perform the fix below and then upgrade to 4.2.

Upgrading from *post 4.0 to 4.2 or higher*:
The work around is to find the offending SearchRequest and replace the contents with "ORDER BY key DESC".
One of the following SQL should identify the troublesome SearchRequests:
{code:sql}
select id from searchrequest where reqcontent is null;
select id from searchrequest where reqcintent = '';
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade Task for Labels can fail a Not Null assertion for SearchRequests with an empty search in Oracle

fields.summary: Gadget filter results picker does not work outside host container

fields.description:
The smart query functionality in JIRA quick search misbehaves when smart query tokens (e.g. 'v:version.x.y') are enclosed by ordinary (not recognized as smart) query tokens and white space characters.
Examples:
# a quick search query: 'blah   r:user   blah' will result in a JQL query: '(summary ~ "blah  blah" OR description ~ "blah  blah" OR comment ~ "blah  blah") AND reporter = user' 
# a quick search query: 'blah   v:version.x.y   blah' will result in a JQL query: '(summary ~ "blah  blah" OR description ~ "blah  blah" OR comment ~ "blah  blah") AND affectedVersion in ("version.x.y")' 

This does not seem right, probably the above queries should be interpreted as non-smart.
fields.summary: Smart query in quick search misinterpreted when enclosed by ordinary query characters and whitespaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23581].
  {panel}

Situation: an option of a custom field that has an empty space at the end, e.g. "test ", when creating an issue and selecting this option, a stacktrace is presented on the screen, saying the selected option is invalid. 

Customers' request is:
1) If spaces at the end of multi select list items is a problem in certain browsers, there should be:
* a warning to users who are creating custom fields
* a way for the user to see if there is an extra space at the end of the list items they've created
* a way for users to edit their list items to remove spaces without having to delete and re-create (and re-order) them.
fields.summary: JIRA should not allow spaces at the end of a custom field option

fields.description:
The grouping of projects is broken when a *Projects* gadget is added to the dashboard and the settings are to display either all categories or multiple categories (for example: Atlassian Products and JIRA Plugins). It appears that the projects are grouped, but that the headings and the associated projects are not displaying one after the other in the right order. 

If an individual category is chosen, the proper projects for that category are displayed.

To test:
Visit: http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa and add the Projects gadget for all categories. See the attached screenshot for an example.
Additionally, when viewing all projects in the page: http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa#all , the projects are grouped properly.
fields.summary: Projects gadget on dashboard not displaying projects in correct categories

fields.description:
Using the portlet "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics", how can I force Jira to display columns with "0" results? For instance, even there is no Blocker Issue, the column blocker should be displayed with result "0". 

In some cases this would be more helpful than the message "The filter for this gadget did not return any issues", especially considering, that the functionality is basically there.
fields.summary: Portlet "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" should show columns with 0 result

fields.description:
When query in JQL on date it is only taking ">=" operator. "=" Operator is not working in term of DATE 

For example project  = <Project Name> AND created = "2011-01-31" is returning "0" records but there are more one record exists for that particular date

Presently the workaround we found is 

project  = <Project Name> AND created > "2011-01-30" and created < "2011-02-01
fields.summary: "=" Operator not working in JQL query

fields.description:
From our customer Steven Ginn (steven@opswat.com):

"In my JIRA instance, I may have customers with several accounts.
I'd like to be able to pull up tickets for all users where the reporter ~ "opswat.com"

In essence, I may be on a call or need to generate a report for open tickets reported by a customer. I know their company name is "OPSWAT" but not whether they are "opswat.com" or "opswat.net". I tried using the "Reporter Domain Name" custom field, and that gets me part of the way...but not all the way there."

fields.description:
I think the #controlFooter macro in templates/plugins/jira/macros.vm has some errors.

Jira 4.2.2's code is 
{code}
#macro(controlFooter $action $description $noHeader)
    #if ($!field && $!field.id)
        #customControlFooter($action $field.id $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #elseif($!customField && $!customField.id)
        #customControlFooter($action $customField.id $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #else
        #customControlFooter($action '' $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #end
#end
{code}

I think that the code is supposed to be 
{code}
#macro(controlFooter $action $description $noHeader)
    #if ($field && $field.id)
        #customControlFooter($action $field.id $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #elseif($customField && $customField.id)
        #customControlFooter($action $customField.id $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #else
        #customControlFooter($action '' $description $!displayParameters $auiparams)
    #end
#end
{code}


Also, this code is inadvertently causing this error in a lot of plugins that utilize the controlFooter macro

{noformat}
2011-01-28 15:24:32,113 http-80-4 ERROR admin 924x2334x1 pdebba 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ConfigureSkipRoles!default.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] query="field" {[id="field" type="8" values=""]}

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

Just discovered this little bug on a support case.

To reproduce the error (that could be avoidable by don't allowing users to edit the Original Estimate after the task is created):
- Create a task, and set the Original Estimate to any value... say '8h'.
- Log work, and log a value greater than the original Estimate... say... '10h'
- Since the time tracking does not make sense anymore, we need to re-set the remaining estimate... however, if a user instead re-sets the Original estimate, the whole time tracking does not make sense anymore.

I've noted that the Original Estimate could not be editable in JIRA 4.1.2: there, you could edit the remaining estimate instead, which makes sense.

Please let me know if you guys need any more info.

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Time Tracking Original Estimate shouldn't be editable

fields.description:
Using the SOAP API to add attachments to issues can cause JIRA to throw an {{OutOfMemoryError}}. This can cause JIRA to become unresponsive and could be used in a denial of service attack, which is especially bad in a multi tenant world.

This happens when using the {{addAttachmentsToIssue}} (now deprecated) with small files (~1MB), and also when using {{addBase64EncodedAttachmentsToIssue}} with large files (~100MB).

The SOAP API implementation should detect attachments that are larger than a certain size and reject the request if the size is exceeded.
fields.summary: adding large attachments with the SOAP api causes OOMEs

- Forgot Password link on the login widget
- Change Password link on the user's profile page

However, if Crowd is the external user management solution, a better solution for users would be to automatically update these links to point to their proper locations within Crowd.

As suggested by a customer, since both of these are Atlassian products, a seamless integration experience would be ideal, if not expected.

fields.description:
The documentation on how JIRA will retain the reporter field value is wrong:
bq. note that, if you do not have the 'Modify Reporter' permission, the clone issue will be created with the same Reporter as the original issue
It should be as below:
bq. note that, if you do not have the 'Modify Reporter' permission, the clone issue will be created with Reporter as the current user cloning the issue

During the cloning process, if the user do not have the *Modify Reporter* permission, there will be this note:
bq. Note: You do not have the "Modify Reporter" permission. You will be the reporter of the clone issue.
fields.summary: JIRA Documentation : Cloning Issue (retaining reporter field value)

fields.description:
Aside for the regular bug tracking tool, we are using Jira as a field support tool which is under some strict SLA requirements.
The first step of handling an issue was to assign it to the handler (it was created unassigned by default).
I couldn't find a way to get the First assigned date, aside for creating a custom field, 
teaching the users not to use the 'Assign' button (that does not appear in the workflow) and to create another transition that will populate the custom field I have created.
This solution is messy and includes educating users. 
I was wondering if I was maybe missing something with the use of the events (that maybe I can catch the 'Issue Assigned' event and use it to populate the field. 
or maybe there is a date field that I have missed.
But if I didn't I think it will be an improvement to be able to play with the 'Assign' action in a workflow and not just permission or notification wise.
fields.summary: Date of first Assignment and maipulating the Assign action in a workflow

fields.description:
When I define services in XML file (which defined UI) which used by  {{com.atlassian.jira.service.AbstractService#getObjectConfiguration()}}

There is some field type. But the mapping with {{String}} and {{text}} is strange.
When I define {{string}}, It's represented by an unlimited text input. 
A UI controle limits to 255 chars the flied value, otherwise
{quote}
Errors
    * Error occurred trying to update service properties: com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters
{quote}
It stored in {{PROPERTYSTRING}} limited to 4000 chars, 

When I define {{text}}, It's represented by an unlimited text area.
But it also stored in {{PROPERTYSTRING}}, where I expect it to be stored in {{PROPERTYTEXT}}

So actually :
|| XML type || UI control || Database table || Database limit ||
| string | 255 | PROPERTYSTRING | 4000 |
| text | 255 | PROPERTYSTRING | 4000 |

It would be more consistent to do 

|| XML type || UI control || Database table || Database limit ||
| string | 4000 | PROPERTYSTRING | 4000 |
| text | none | PROPERTYTEXT | none |


{code:xml|title=service.xml|borderStyle=solid}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<userservice id="service_id">
<description>description</description>
<properties>
...
<property>
	<key>Key</key>
	<name>name</name>
	<description>description</description>
	<type>string</type>
</property>
<property>
	<key>another key</key>
	<name>another name</name>
	<description>another description</description>
	<type>string</type>
</property>
...
</properties>
</userservice>
{code}
fields.summary: Mapping between XML service definition and database storage
